channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report X-2024071126
item.description:
Report X-2024071126

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE CAME FROM LOADSIDE WET ON TOP AND TORN OPEN. DAMAGED DURING SORTATION. PACKAGE MAY HAVE BEEN PLACED UPSIDE DOWN. ONE BOTTLE LEAKED FROM TIGHT CAP AND DEFECTIVE SEAL. 4/10THS OF A GALLON LOSS. SPILL NEUTRALIZED AND COLLECTED WITH PHNINE AND WHISK BROOM WITH DUST PAN. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2024071091
item.description:
Report X-2024071091

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE CAME FROM UNLOAD CRUSHED AND LEAKING WHITE POWDER. PACKAGE DAMAGED IN TRANSIT. NOT ENOUGH PROTECTIVE INTERNAL PACKAGING. SOLID POWDER POOL CHEM LEAKED FROM DRUM DUE TO TRAVEL VIBRATION. 1 POUND OF MATERIAL LOSS. SPILL COLLECTED WITH WHISK BROOM AND DUST PAN. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report E-2024070330
item.description:
Report E-2024070330

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-10
  • City: FONTANA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 10, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3286 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew overpacked the damaged drum in one (1) 95-gallon drum. GES personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted material was collected in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024070312
item.description:
Report E-2024070312

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-08
  • City: CERES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 6, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3109 was damaged and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the loading dock and tote. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in with hand tools. Approximately 30-gallons of UN3267 were hand pumped into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. All impacted material were containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon poly drum. The crew pumped the virgin product into one (1) new tote for continued shipment.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Exterior packaging was wet and torn on all sides. Discoloration on the box is everywhere that the box is wet. Inside are 2 boxes. 1 is a 3 pack box of 121 fl oz plastic bottles of CloroxPro Germicidal Bleach Concentrate, and the other contains 1 bottle of the same product. Total of 4. All of the bottles have dents on the body and caused a crack where the contents leaked out of.

  • Description: Upon inspection it was found that the package was wet from the top after being tipped over. It was discovered that the package contained 2 hazardous bottles (rapicidepa part a) and 2 nonhazardous bottles (rapicidepa part b). It was found that one of the part b bottles had a loose cap resulting in the leakage.

  • Description: PACKAGE CAME FROM LOADSIDE WET, TORN AND RETAPED ON BOTTOM. TOO MUCH REHANDLE, WAS MISSORTED TO WOODBRIDGE, NJ WITH PACKAGE MARKED FOR WOODBRIDGE, CA. ONE BOTTLE LEAKED FROM VENTED CAP, VERY HOT WEATHER. SPILL MINOR, ISOLATED TO PACKAGING. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report E-2024070030
item.description:
Report E-2024070030

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-15T18:15:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-01
  • City: SOUTH GATE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: J. B. HUNT TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 3ft-by-5ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that thirty (30) gallons of material was released due to four (4) crushed 5-gallon plastic pails. The damaged plastic pails were placed into one (1) 30-gallon and one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. Clean Harbors personnel deployed a neutralizer to the impacted area and then used a granular absorbent to gather the spent material. The contractor placed the recovered spent absorbents into one (1) 30-gallon poly drum. One (1) 55-gallon poly drum was generated containing impacted pallet pieces. One (1) additional 15-gallon poly drum was generated for the contractor’s PPE. All waste generated from this response was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for J.B. Hunt contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

Manuel stated he thinks the pail was crushed at the bottom by the back stop of the forklift while loading the pallet into the trailer. Manuel stated it looks to be around 8oz of the product has spilled onto the trailer floor.

item.description:
Report X-2024070690

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-12T15:12:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-01
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Exterior packaging is wet and torn on the underside of the box. Opened the box from the top and what was on the top side of the box is the underside of the bottles. These bottles are 2 qty of 2.5 gallon white plastic bottles of Noble Chemical Breaker 1, Liquid Soil Breaker. With the cap side at the bottom of the box, in reference to the orientation arrow of the box, the pressure of the weight led the liquid to spill with both bottles losing approximately 8 fl oz each.

item.title: Report X-2024070670
item.description:
Report X-2024070670

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-12T15:12:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-01
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was found at the LAXR location. The fiberboard box contained four metal cans with positive closure rings and fiberboard dividers. One of the metal cans inside split at the bottom chime causing the release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.
